Physical Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for Physical:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A physical value.

This is a 'something' that has a physical dimension (like time, weight, length...). It has a physical unit and a name (like 'voltage'). Use physical.uUnit().set(...) to set the physical unit.

Member Function Documentation

virtual string Physical::getName (  )  [virtual]

Retriev the name.

The name is constructed from the physical name (like "membrane voltage") and the unit symbol (like "mV"). In this example is would read "membrane voltage [mV]".

Reimplemented in Stochastic.

virtual string Physical::getPhysicalName (  )  [inline, virtual]

Returns the physical name.

This is the name of the physical dimension of the object, if it has any. ("" otherwise)

Reimplemented in Time.

void Physical::setName ( string  name  ) 

Set the name.

The name of the physical quantity, like 'voltage'

Reimplemented in Function, Matrix, and Stochastic.

void Physical::setUnitPrefix ( int  n  ) 

Set unit prefix.

Set the unit prefix by giving an integer from -24 to 24. Should be a multiple of 3, exception: -2,-1,2,1.
